numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a large gap between the percentage of young women who contact their parents and the percentage of young men who contact their parents.
2. I notice that the smallest gap between men and women is for visiting parents in person.
3. I notice that visiting parents in person has the smallest percentage for contacting parents.
4. I wonder what the age range is for the graph.
5. I wonder whether the graph is about college-aged young adults.
6. I wonder whether the graph is about young adults in their twenties.
7. I wonder why women are more inclined to contact their parents.
8. I wonder whether women contact their parents more because women use their phones more.
9. I wonder whether the people who visit their parents live closer to home.
10. I wonder whether the people who visit their parents are out of college.
11. This relates to me and my community.
12. This shows that our generation should contact our parents more often.
13. It is important to stay in contact with your parents.
14. It is important to stay in contact with other family members.
15. I have 2 brothers.
16. One brother is in college.
17. One brother lives in New York City.
18. My parents get excited when they talk to my brothers.
19. This shows that talking to their children is important to my parents.
20. The headline is: Stay connected!
